Pre-Game Insights: The National League Division Series is currently tied at one game apiece after a drama-filled Game 2 Sunday night at Dodgers Stadium.
San Diego Padres ace right-hander Michael King is set to take the mound for the Friars.
Dodger designated hitter Shohei Ohtani is 6-for-14 lifetime against King for a.429 batting average with three home runs and four RBIs.
Others: Officials in Petco Park are attempting to cool the emotions running hot between National League West rival San Diego Padres and Los Angeles Dodgers, who are set for Game 3 in the city's East Village on Tuesday night.
ESPN's matchup predictor gives the Padres a 64.7% chance of winning, the Dodgers a 35.3% chances.
